TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlConditions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a set of conditions that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions and a set of conditions that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion. The SamlConditions class represents the set of conditions. An example of a condition is whether the SAML assertion must not be cached, which is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition> class.
The SAML specification defines two conditions and it allows for the set of conditions to be extended. The two conditions defined by the SAML specification are <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition>. To define a new condition, derive a class from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.IsReadOnly%2A> property to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.DateTime notBefore, valuetype System.DateTime notOnOrAfter) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the earliest instant in time when the SAML assertion is valid. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> property.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time when the SAML assertion expires. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified timeframe that the SAML assertion is valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A> properties are stored in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

MemberSignature.Value: public SamlConditions (DateTime notBefore, DateTime notOnOrAfter, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition> conditions);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.DateTime notBefore, valuetype System.DateTime notOnOrAfter, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition> conditions) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the earliest instant in time when the SAML assertion is valid. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> property.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time when the SAML assertion expires. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A> property.

An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type that specifies a set of conditions that a recipient of a SAML assertion must take into account in assessing the validity of the assertion. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.Conditions%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified timeframe and conditions when the SAML assertion is valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A> properties are stored in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

Docs.summary: Gets the set of conditions that must be taken into consideration when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type that specifies a set of conditions that a recipient of a SAML assertion must take into account when assessing the validity of the assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Conditions property corresponds to the `\<saml:Conditions>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
Docs.value: if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void MakeReadOnly() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes this instance to be read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.

Docs.summary: Gets the earliest instant in time when the SAML assertion is valid.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the earliest instant in time when the SAML assertion is valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The NotBefore property corresponds to the `NotBefore` attribute of the `<saml:Conditions>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

Docs.summary: Gets the instant in time when the SAML assertion expires.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time when the SAML assertion expires.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> property corresponds to the `NotOnOrAfter` attribute of the `<saml:Conditions>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

A that determines the security token that created the digital signature.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ReadXml method sets the following properties:
- <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A>
- <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A>
- <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.Conditions%2A>

A that is capable of writing clauses.
Docs.summary: Writes the element into the specified XML serializer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the WriteXml method to write the current <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions> instance into a `<saml:Conditions>` element.
